intro: Unonopsis stevensii, commonly known as the Stewart's unonopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
